- "After event1, no other events can happen." That means once event1 has happened, no subsequent event (including event2) can occur.
- "After event2, no other events can happen." Similarly, if event2 happens, no subsequent events can occur.

- C2: "C1 holds and event1 happens." This is equivalent to "(event2 happens and event1 happens) and event1 happens", i.e. simply "event1 happens and event2 happens" (repeating event1 adds nothing).

- From (1) and (2): event1 has occurred initially. Because "after event1 no other events can happen," no further events (including event2) can occur after that initial event1.

- Therefore C1 ("event1 and event2 happen") is false, and hence C2 (which is equivalent to C1) is also false.
